channel.title: PC crash prevention
channel.description:
Just a few moments ago my laptop crashed because it sucks dick and I overloaded it. I was downloading, playing some music and when I tried to save some homework I made in Excel it crashed. I do realise that it's partially because Vista is cock.
So I was thinking, isn't it possible to prevent the user from overloading that what's being overloaded? I mean, the kernel assigns memory and cpu usage to all the applications right? So if it senses that it has to assign more then it can assign, it should make somekind of que.
Most businesses work like that, if they have to produce more then their capacity, they either cancel orders or put yours on a waiting list. If a company doesnt do that it gets angry customers, just like I am angry because the fucking thing crashed.
So, am I asking/expecting too much, or am I a genius for coming up with something? [size=1pt](I think it's the first option) It's possible that this post consists of nothing but bullshit. If true, my apology's.[/size]

item.title: PC crash prevention
item.dc:creator: @pk4pk pk4pk
item.description:
@pk4pk wrote:

[quote=“BloodRayne, post:9, topic:238301”]Apologies.*

I’ve had Vista since late '07, and I haven’t had any crashes yet… I’m constantly running SAM Broadcaster, Zune software, uTorrent, MSN, AIM, along with some other things I randomly have open, such as Adobe or Autodesk products.

Am I just lucky? Do a lot of people have frequent crashes with Vista?[/quote]
No, just alot of people bitch for no reason and usually it’s their fault. I have vista for 1.5 years + and nothing bad has happen. All my games work fine except RTW witch dosen’t work.

Read full topic

Apologies.*

item.title: PC crash prevention
item.dc:creator: @FastBallz FastBawlz
item.description:
@FastBallz wrote:

[quote=“bowserjr2, post:4, topic:238301”]Vista is the cause of the crashing.
All should now know that it is bad.
Use Windows XP or Linux.[/quote]

[quote=“bowserjr2, post:6, topic:238301”]I have tryed both (XP and Vista), Vista crashes more often.
Do you have 2-4 GB RAM?
If not its not weird that it crashes[/quote]

I have had 2 crashes with Vista (I’ve had Vista for a year and a half), both were because my PSU wattage is to low to support my GFX card.
So, it’s not Vista. GTFO of the bandwagon.

Read full topic

item.title: PC crash prevention
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

Well, in Linux, if the application makes a memory allocation request greater than that which the system can fulfill, it dies with a segmentation fault (SIGSEG). I would assume Windows should have something like that, and I doubt running low on memory was your issue (Windows also tries to expand the pagefile to accommodate memory requests when running low on memory, virtual or otherwise), your processor probably started to overheat so your motherboard shut your computer down or something of the sort to protect it.

Read full topic

item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

item.title: PC crash prevention
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

I don’t have much experience with Linux, but I do know that XP has the same problems. Altough most people doubt that the employees at Microsoft have any knowledge, I do know that the kernel of Vista is based on the one of XP.

Read full topic

item.title: PC crash prevention
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“bowserjr2, post:2, topic:238301”]OpenOffice have an autosave function that can save your documents every 1 minute, this will not help prevent crash, but you won’t lose so much work. (15 minute is defult, but you can set it at 1 minute.)
Or just try to don’t use so much programs, or change OS, that will help for the crashing problem.[/quote]

That wasn’t my question, it was merely the cause of me asking the question.

Read full topic

item.title: PC crash prevention
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

OpenOffice have an autosave function that can save your documents every 1 minute, this will not help prevent crash, but you won’t lose so much work. (15 minute is defult, but you can set it at 1 minute.)
Or just try to don’t use so much programs, or change OS, that will help for the crashing problem.
